definition: to calculate/to compute/to count/to regard as important/to plan/ruse/meter/gauge
car/vehicle/CL:輛|辆[liang4]/machine/to shape with a lathe/Kangxi radical 159

sentences.english: Early one morning, they took a taxi to Beijing West Railway Station.
sentences.chinese: 第一個早晨，他們坐計程車到北京西火車站。

sentences.english: The bartender comes over and refuses service to the man and again offers to call a cab.
sentences.chinese: 酒保過來說不能給他酒喝，再次提議幫他叫部計程車。

sentences.english: Execuse me, where can I get the cab, please?
sentences.chinese: 對不起，請問那裏可以叫計程車？

sentences.english: For many, driving a taxi is merely a part-time job.
sentences.chinese: 對大多數美國人而言，開計程車只是一種副業。

sentences.english: It's next to impossible to catch a taxi at night during the year- end party season.
sentences.chinese: 聯歡會季節，晚上是幾乎不可能叫到計程車的。

sentences.english: Where can I change some money to pay the taxi?
sentences.chinese: 我到哪裏去換零錢來付計程車車費？

sentences.english: The taxi dropped them off at the harbor in front of the Alaskan Princess.
sentences.chinese: 計程車在“阿拉斯加公主”號的港口前讓他們下車。

sentences.english: Here you have to wait for a taxi at a taxi stand.
sentences.chinese: 您必須在計程車招呼站等候。

sentences.english: We were whisked off in a taxi before we knew where we were.
sentences.chinese: 我們還沒弄明白是在哪兒，就被計程車載走了。

sentences.english: Another distinguishing feature are the double decked bus and taxi.
sentences.chinese: 英國的另一個特色是雙層巴士和計程車。

sentences.english: Nabbed a nice cabbie for the way home.
sentences.chinese: 搭了輛不錯的計程車回家了。

sentences.english: They enjoy their lifestyle, and so does cabdriver Jesus.
sentences.chinese: 他們盡情享受自己的生活，計程車司機耶蘇也是如此。

sentences.english: One night, China on the honor of the taxi, car crash, the two men were in a coma.
sentences.chinese: 一晚，華上了榮的計程車，車子失事，二人昏迷不醒。

sentences.english: Taipei's taxi association announced a resolution that they are going to raise fare prices by 25 percent.
sentences.chinese: 臺北市計程車公會做出決議，票價將漲兩成五。

sentences.english: Taxis usually have meters that show how much money you have to pay.
sentences.chinese: 計程車通常有計時錶，表上會顯示你要付多少錢。

sentences.english: She suddenly remembered that she had left her cellular-phone in the taxi .
sentences.chinese: 她突然想起來她將她的手機留在計程車上了。

definition: bus/abbr. for 公共汽車|公共汽车[gong1 gong4 qi4 che1]/car belonging to an organization and used by its members (government car, police car, company car etc)/abbr. for 公務用車|公务用车[gong1 wu4 yong4 che1]
to pull up (stop one's vehicle)/to park/(of a machine) to stop working/to stall
to get on or into (a bus, train, car etc)
to transfer/to change trains, buses etc
to call a cab (by phone)/to request a ride (via an app)
